trans-unit.source: Combines multiple dependencies between an item stored in an ASP.NET application's <xref href="System.Web.Caching.Cache"></xref> object and an array of <xref href="System.Web.Caching.CacheDependency"></xref> objects.
This class cannot be inherited.
The <xref:System.Web.Caching.AggregateCacheDependency> class monitors a collection of dependency objects so that when any of them change, the cached item is automatically removed.

The objects in the array can be <xref:System.Web.Caching.CacheDependency> objects, <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependency> objects, custom objects derived from <xref:System.Web.Caching.CacheDependency>, or any combination of these.

The <xref:System.Web.Caching.AggregateCacheDependency> class differs from the <xref:System.Web.Caching.CacheDependency> class in that it allows you to associate multiple dependencies of different types with a single cached item.

For example, if you create a page that imports data from a SQL Server database table and an XML file, you can create a <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependency> object to represent a dependency on the database table and a <xref:System.Web.Caching.CacheDependency> to represent the dependency on the XML file.

Rather than making an <xref:System.Web.Caching.Cache.Insert%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method call for each dependency, you can create an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Caching.AggregateCacheDependency> class with each dependency added to it.
You can then use a single <xref:System.Web.Caching.Cache.Insert%2A> call to make the page dependent on the <xref:System.Web.Caching.AggregateCacheDependency> instance.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Caching.AggregateCacheDependency"></xref> class.
This is the default constructor for the <xref:System.Web.Caching.AggregateCacheDependency> class.
Adds an array of <xref href="System.Web.Caching.CacheDependency"></xref> objects to the <xref href="System.Web.Caching.AggregateCacheDependency"></xref> object.
The array of <xref href="System.Web.Caching.CacheDependency"></xref> objects to add.
dependencies is `null`.
\- or -
A object in dependencies is `null`.
A <xref href="System.Web.Caching.CacheDependency"></xref> object is referenced from more than one <xref href="System.Web.Caching.Cache"></xref> entry.
Gets the file dependencies.
The file dependencies.
Retrieves a unique identifier for the <xref href="System.Web.Caching.AggregateCacheDependency"></xref> object.
This method assigns a unique identifier to each dependency in the array and returns each of them.
The identifier is a combination of either the file name (for a file dependency) or the key name (for a cache-key dependency) and a string that this method assigns to the dependency.
The unique identifier for the <xref href="System.Web.Caching.AggregateCacheDependency"></xref> object.
If one of the associated dependency objects does not have a unique identifier, the <xref href="System.Web.Caching.AggregateCacheDependency.GetUniqueID"></xref> method returns `null`.
